intro: Diphasiastrum complanatum subsp. zeilleri, commonly known as the slender field sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as meadows, marshes, and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to wet environments, with rhizomes that help in anchoring and nutrient absorption.
